0.content:
<dawnstar>
The Dawnstar is the heir apparant to the royal throne, and is the beloved child of King Oberon, the current Eveningstar. The Dawnstar is protected at all times by at least one of their Starkeepers. Titles that one might use to address the Dawnstar are "Your Grace", "Starlight", "Prince/Princess" or simply "Star".
</dawnstar>

1.content:
<houses>
Starfall is home to many noble houses, of both human and non-human families.
Noble lineage is traced through the maternal line, with the eldest child (male or female) succeeding. Polyandry is common, with polygamy being less socially accepted.
All houses are expected to swear oaths of fealty to the crown.
Northern houses are often suspected of disloyalty due to their proximity to the territory of Irradiya.

It is not uncommon for younger sons or daughters to be sent to Skycrest to train to be Knights.
House Alcuin: the grim and war-hardened people of Ironhall
House Athari: the icy beauty of Crystalhame
House Arcandam: the lonely tragedy of Duskhollow
House Crescas: the half-elves and true friends of the crown of Highwind Keep
House Erlewine: the peaceful weavers of death of Mistfall
House Gaffarel: the pirates and scoundrels of Stormhaven
House Greene: the dragonriders and troubled history of Balefire Reach
House Hand: the faithful and true believers of Moonmont
House Faleiro: the fair and festive culture of Shimmerglass
House Fauxe: the cursed hunters of Trophyhill
House Mead: the prosperity and inequality of Goldenfield
House Pascal: the nobility and honor of Steelhold
House Ridwan: the dark magic and of grim port Raven's Watch
House Rodden: the sea-salted sailors of Crowsroost
House Wells: the shimmering oasis of Sunhold
</houses>

2.content:
<skycrest>
SKYCREST
Location: Central-Northern Eternia
Ruling House: The Royal Family
Sub-Locations: Starlight Keep (royal castle), Garden District (noble manors), Waterway District (docks, warehouses, merchant quarters), The Tunnels (underground passages, city underbelly)

Capital city of Starfall kingdom, built in a valley with rivers and waterfalls. White stone architecture, canals throughout. Seat of royal family, Starlight Keep castle at highest point. Divided into districts for nobility, trade, and a seedy underground. Center of governance, religion, trade and culture. Strict social hierarchy. Multiple temples including grand Cathedral of Polaris.
</skycrest>

3.content:
<ironhall>
IRONHALL
Location: Northern Eternia, on Irradiya border
Ruling House: House Alcuin
Sub-Locations: Great Forge, Valor Hall, war hero monuments

Fortress-city on snowy mountain plateau. Imposing blackstone and iron walls, heavy artillery. Seat of martially-renowned House Alcuin. Known for skilled knights, warriors, weaponsmiths. Constant metalworking, smoke from forges. Rough charm, people known for bravery and loyalty. Paranoid atmosphere due to enemy proximity, fear of infiltration by Irradiya spies. Harsh treatment of suspected traitors by Alcuin lords.
</ironhall>

4.content:
<sunhold>
SUNHOLD
Location: Eastern Eternia
Ruling House: House Wells
Sub-Locations: Sunspire (Wells keep), The Oasis (garden at mesa base)

City-oasis built into and around massive sandstone mesa. City carved into mesa rock, with Sunspire keep at summit. Oasis at base with gardens fed by aquifer. Major trade hub for caravans and exotic goods, known for skilled weavers. House Wells controls lucrative eastern trade routes, especially spice trade. Surrounding desert home to bandits and rumored monsters.
</sunhold>

5.content:
<ravens_watch>
RAVEN'S WATCH
Location: North-western Eternia
Ruling House: House Ridwan
Sub-Locations: Ridwan Keep, Ravenscript Academy, Docks

Somber cliffside city, built of dark stone and weathered wood next to the Starless Sea. Grim, imposing Ridwan Keep oversees city. Ridwans rumored to practice dark magic. Despite ominous air, a city of learning - home to prestigious Ravenscript Academy for magic and esoteric arts. Important but unnerving port, with busy docks overseen by Ridwan watchtowers.
<ravens_watch>

6.content:
<crowsroost>
CROWSROOST
Location: Southern Point
Ruling House: House Rodden
Sub-Locations: The Aviary (rookery tower), Salt Court (execution grounds), Brinehold (wave-flooded dungeons)

Ancient cliffside fortress over southern seas. Battered by wind and waves, exudes grim majesty. Aviary tower houses intelligent crows serving as messengers, spies, and omens. House Rodden are stern, black-clad masters of the sea. All Roddens expected to earn "sea-name" serving on house ships. Rumored to practice strange rites in sea caves beneath fortress.
</crowsroost>

7.content:
<crystalhame>
CRYSTALHAME
Location: Western Eternia
Ruling House: House Athari
Sub-Locations: Lunar Hall (throne room), Athenaeum (ice library), The Crypts (frozen tombs)

Resplendent ice citadel, with crystalline spires and buttresses. Structure seems grown from glacier. Athari hold court in cavernous Lunar Hall on ice thrones, known for silver hair, and unearthly beauty. Athenaeum holds knowledge etched in ice sheets. Crypts house ancestors in frozen sarcophagi, rumored to hold secret of Athari longevity. Athari rule detached from common folk in crystal homes at citadel base.
</crystalhame>

8.content:
<duskhollow>
DUSKHOLLOW
Location: Northern Eternia 
Ruling House: House Arcandam
Sub-Locations: Duskhollow forest, Hollowstone keep, Polaris' Heir barrow (rumored)

Misty, dark forest rumored to be Polaris' Heir's resting place. Inhabited by nocturnal creatures. Hollowstone, the grim Arcandam keep, sits at the forest's edge. House Arcandam is believed cursed, dwindled to two members - the young and melancholy Lord Arcandam, and his uncle, Lord Samael Arcandam. Crumbling ruins hidden in the forest, whispered to be haunted.
</duskhollow>

9.content:
BALEFIRE REACH
East Eternia
House Greene

Balefire Reach is a storm-lashed headland situated in the shadow of Mount Pyralis, an active volcano that looms over the surrounding ash-rich forests. The humid, tropical climate created by the volcano's heat is ideal for cultivating the region's famed spices and citrus fruits. But Balefire Reach is most renowned as the nesting grounds of Starfall's dragons and the training grounds of the Duskborne Shields, the kingdom's elite order of dragonriders.


House Greene rules Balefire Reach, but not without controversy. A century ago, the Reach's previous rulers, House Balefire, were branded as traitors for the actions of Eoin Balefire, who attempted to assassinate the Eveningstar and seize the throne. Though House Greene was granted dominion over the Reach for their role in thwarting the plot, some still whisper that the Greenes were complicit in Eoin's treason as a means to usurp their rivals. The burnt-out husk of the Balefire's ancestral keep still stands on the headland, a grim reminder of the family's downfall.


The Greenes have held on to power in part by reforming the selection of new dragonriders. In the past, only noble-born sons could join the Duskborne Shields. But under the Greenes, any child who shows an affinity for dragon kinship may be chosen, regardless of bloodline. This affinity is tested in the Night of Choosing, held each solstice. In a torch-lit cavern, children stand before a clutch of dragon eggs, hoping one will hatch for them. The lucky few become novice dragonriders, training in the keeps and aeries carved into the volcanic cliffs.


Mount Pyralis is key to the dragons' presence in the Reach. Tunnels and caves warmed by the volcano's heat riddle the headland, forming perfect nesting chambers. The dragons themselves are drawn to the volcano, sometimes disappearing inside for weeks at a time for reasons unknown. Some speculate they feed upon the energy of the molten earth itself.



The Blackfire Beacon, a colossal lighthouse of gleaming obsidian, stands eternal vigil over this domain. Every year, during the festival of Dragonsnight, the Beacon's flames burn green to honor the fallen riders and their noble steeds. It is said that the Beacon's light can be seen even in Irradiya, a warning and a challenge to those who would threaten the Reach.

10.content:
<mistfall>
MISTFALL
Location: South Eternia
Ruling House: House Erlewine
Sub-Locations: Whisperwind Cathedral

Ethereal town in a misty river delta, known for silk production and reverence of death. Cobblestone streets twist like a labyrinth. Whisperwind Cathedral is the heart of worship for Haunt, god of death and dreams. Ruled by House Erlewine, famed for a history of self-inflicted blindness in honor of the prophetic Deathdreamers of old. Macabre funerary rites and traditions permeate Mistfall's culture.
</mistfall>

11.content:
<stormhaven>
STORMHAVEN
Ruling House: House Gaffarel
Sub-Locations: Gaffarel Keep, Drowned Market, Flotsam Quay, The Hanged Man tavern, Widow's Lament tavern

Grim, gray pirate port beneath stormy skies. Ruled by House Gaffarel, descendants of pirate king granted lordship. Hardscrabble town of steep roofs, crooked alleys, shady taverns and dealings. Seedy underworld. Tense balance between pirate traditions and Starfall authority. Dour, suspicious populace carved by the unforgiving environment.
</stormhaven>

12.content:
<steelhold>
STEELHOLD
Location: Northern Eternia
Ruling House: House Pascal
Sub-Locations: Last Citadel (ancient keep), Spear of Dawn (tallest tower), Avenue of Valor (main thoroughfare), Hall of Swords (gathering hall), Grand Arena (training grounds)
Formidable city-fortress in the Dawnspire Mountains foothills. High stone walls and sturdy towers. Traditional culture, emphasizing honor, chivalry, and loyalty. Home to the Knights of the Argent Sword, Starfall's finest warriors. Ruled by House Pascal, descendants of legendary knight Galahad Pascal.
</steelhold>

13.content:
<goldenfield>
GOLDENFIELD
Location: Central Eternia
Ruling House: House Mead
Sub-Locations: Lycaeum (university), Honeyheart (Mead manor), The Buzzing Bee (famous tavern), Marketplace
Prosperous city known for its golden wheat fields, honey production, and the prestigious Lycaeum university. Ruled by the opulent and hedonistic House Mead. Thriving trade hub, but with whispers of class inequality and a growing revolutionary movement.
</goldenfield>

14.content:
<highwind>
HIGHWIND KEEP
West Eternia
Ruling House: House Crescas
Sub-Locations: Great Library, Grand Hall

Remote cliff-top citadel of blended elven and human architecture. Seat of half-elven House Crescas, stalwart yet enigmatic bloodline. Famed library of ancient lore. Vital bulwark against fae-haunted western forests. Grand hall where Lord Althalos holds court. Weathered keep steeped in mystery, steadfast in crown loyalty despite whispered rumors.
</highwind>

15.content:
<trophyhill>
TROPHYHILL
Western Eternia
Seat of House Fauxe
Sub-Locations: Fauxe Keep, Skinners' Quarter, Beastmasters' Guild

Walled town in vast primeval forest. Ruled by House Fauxe from keep filled with beast trophies. Hardscrabble human populace suited to harsh environs and bloody hunting trade. Leatherworkers, smiths, alchemists support hunt-based economy. Fauxes cursed by fae druidess, forever pursuing deadlier game. Tense history with forest fae.
</trophyhill>

16.content:
<moonmont>
MOONMONT
Eastern Eternia
Seat of House Hand
Sub-Locations: Cathedra Solaris, Cathedra Nocturne, Lord's Vigil

Imposing holy citadel in Mount Ascension. Countless temples to gods Sel and Polaris. Millennia-old place of pilgrimage. House Hand descended from Sel's first high priest. Pious and crown-loyal. Home to elite knight-monks of the Lord's Vigil who guard the mount and smite the faithless.
</moonmont>

17.content:
<shimmerglass>
SHIMMERGLASS
Eastern Eternia
Seat of House Faleiro
Sub-Locations: Shimmerglass College, Fashion District, Ceramic Quarter, Painters' Plaza, Crafter's Commons

Vibrant port hailed as Eternia's cultural heart. Famed arts scene with theaters, galleries, bardic college. Distinctive creative districts for fashion, ceramics, painting, crafting. Haven for freethinkers founded by exiled Faleiros. Exceptionally diverse citizenry of many races contributing rare talents. City of inspiration and collaboration.
</shimmerglass>

18.content: All major holdings in the Kingdom of Starfall.

20.content:
<house_wells>
HOUSE WELLS
[Rules Sunhold, the eastern desert oasis]
HEAD: Lady Nayara Wells
SIGIL: Golden sand dune bisected by winding blue river
WORDS: "Enduring as the Sands"
REPUTATION: Pragmatic, wealthy, key to the spice trade
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ATHARI, positive - marriage alliances
HOUSE GAFFAREL, positive - smuggling deals
HOUSE PASCAL, positive - major steel importer
</house_wells>

21.content:
<house_alcuin>
HOUSE ALCUIN
[Rules over Ironhall, in the frozen far north]
HEAD: Lord Cedric Alcuin
SIGIL: A black mountain silhouetted against a crimson sky, bisected by a silver longsword
WORDS: "Iron Endures"
REPUTATION: Grim, war-hardened, fiercely loyal to the crown
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ATHARI, negative - ancient rivalry
HOUSE ERLEWINE, positive - strong trade ties
HOUSE FAUXE, negative - disapprove of their "unsavory" hunting practices
</house_alcuin>

22.content:
<royal_family>
It is believed that the royal family of Eternia is descended from a mythical figure known as "Polaris' heir", a great hero and the child of the gods Polaris and Sel, who "lifted the darkness" from Starfall.
The royal lineage experiences enjoys both long lifespans and a seeming immunity to disease or other mortal ailments.
The royal family has no given house name; the members are mostly referred to by honorifics or titles, which are:

FALLINGSTAR: prior monarch
EVENINGSTAR: ruling monarch
DAWNSTAR: royal heir
STARLIGHT: royal progeny and other relatives
The current monarch of Starfall is the Eveningstar, King Oberon.
Members of the royal family have golden blood, proving that they are more than merre mortals.
</royal_family>

23.content:
<house_ridwan>
HOUSE RIDWAN
[Rules Raven's Watch, the grim northwest port]
HEAD: Lord Malakai Ridwan
SIGIL: Onyx raven perched on silver crescent moon
WORDS: "Knowledge is Power"
REPUTATION: Shadowy, ambitious, steeped in dark magic
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ATHARI, positive - trade forbidden artifacts
HOUSE PASCAL, negative - disapprove of their ways
HOUSE RODDEN, positive - use their ships for rituals
</house_ridwan>

26.content:
<the_eight>
The Eight are a pantheon of minor deities in the Eternian religion, subservient to the major gods Polaris and Sel. Each has dominion over specific aspects of nature or society. Worshippers may pray to individual Eight for blessings in their domain. The Eight sometimes choose mortal champions.
The Eight are:
Haunt, benevolent and kindly god of death, depicted as a melancholy spectre. Guides souls to the afterlife.
Verdan, vain and debauched god of nature. Eternally youthful satyr-like being. Blesses harvests and hunts.
Cinder, temperamental god of fire, passion and wrath. Patron of dragons and their knights.
Whisper, androgynous and sly god of secrets. Knows all, sees all from the shadows. Appears often as a great serpent.
Swell, moody, mercurial goddess of oceans and storms. Seafarers pray to her for safe passage.
Zephyr, free-spirited and whimsical god of the winds. Wanders the world as a vagrant. Patron of travelers.
Verve, sensual and alluring genderless god of fertility, depicted as a shadow. Invoked for matters of love and desire.
</the_eight>

27.content:
<polaris>
Polaris is the Eternian god of night, darkness, and the moon. Brother to Sel and father to the mythical Polaris' Heir. Polaris is stern but just and merciful, granting wisdom and strength to those who revere the night. His symbols are the crescent moon and owl. The Eveningstar dynasty descends from Polaris. Polaris is depicted as an older man with silver hair and eyes that shine like starlight.
</polaris>

28.content:
<sel>
Sel is the Eternian goddess of day, light, and the sun. Elder sister of Polaris, Sel is bold and compassionate, blessing followers with vitality and abundance. Her symbols are the radiant sun and eagle. Sel is depicted as a female warrior with flaming hair. Sel is celebrated during harvest festivals.
</sel>

29.content:
<polaris_heir>
Polaris' Heir was a legendary demigod hero, born of Polaris' seed, who banished a great darkness from Starfall centuries ago. Possessed divine might and wisdom. Founded the Eveningstar dynasty which rules Starfall to this day. Though long dead, Polaris' Heir is still revered as a hero.
</polaris_heir>

31.content:
<keeper>
Keepers are elite guards who serve the royal family and nobility as protectors, companions, and lovers. Royals may have multiple Keepers, while nobles have one. Keepers are chosen in adulthood by their lord/lady, often through trials, and are usually skilled knights.  Keepers protect their star and fulfill all their companionship needs, including romantic desires. While knights are preferred, Keepers can be of any race or background. The Dawnstar traditionally takes six Keepers.
</keeper>

32.content:
<maternal_lineage>
Noble and royal families in Starfall trace lineage and inheritance through the female line. Rulers succeed their mothers, not fathers. Surnames are passed from mothers to children. Male consorts marry into the lady's family, although any sex may inherit. This matrilineal system is sacred tradition, supposedly decreed by the goddess Sel.
</maternal_lineage>

33.content:
<polyamory>
Polyamorous relationships, particularly polyandry (a woman having multiple husbands), are common and accepted among Eternia's nobility, supported by the matrilineal system of inheritance. Polygyny (a man having multiple wives) is legal but less socially favored. Most noble marriages are arranged for political or economic reasons, with love matches being rare.
</polyamory>

35.content:
<elves>
Elves are a long-lived race native to Eternia, generally considered more magically attuned than humans. Dark elves, also known as "Night elves", are the most common, known for their affinity with nature and the earth and mostly live in mountains or underground. 
High elves, also called "leeches," rule the rival nation of Irradiya and possess innate vampiric abilities. Wood elves inhabit the kingdom's forests, living in harmony with the wilds.
</elves>

36.content:
<hybrids>
Hybrids are individuals of mixed racial ancestry, such as half-elves or half-orcs. Demi-humans, which are humans with animal traits like ears, tails and wings, are also a common type of hybrid. Though not uncommon in Eternia, they often face discrimination from both sides of their heritage. Many find acceptance in more cosmopolitan areas like Shimmerglass or in adventuring companies.
</hybrids>

37.content:
<keeper_selection>
Starkeepers are chosen by their noble "star" upon the star's 20th birthday. The selection process varies - some stars devise trials or challenges to test candidates' worthiness, while others simply appoint a Keeper they deem suitable. Regardless of method, the star's decision is absolute. Most Keepers are knights, valued for their martial skill and chivalric oaths of loyalty.
</keeper_selection>

38.content:
<keeper_vow>
Upon selection, a Starkeeper kneels before their star and swears a sacred, lifelong vow to serve them in all ways - as guard, companion, confidant and lover. This vow can only be dissolved by death or direct decree of the Eveningstar. Breaking the vow is considered both high treason and heresy, punishable by execution.
</keeper_vow>

39.content:
<sayings>
Eternia has several unique idioms, curses and slang phrases.

"By the Eight!" - Common curse invoking the eight minor deities. Expresses shock or exasperation.

"Polaris' bane" - Euphemism for illness, especially mental affliction. Considered more polite than naming a disease outright.

"Moonglow and shade" - Phrase meaning the full truth, the light and dark. Refers to Polaris (night/shade) and Sel's (day/light) all-seeing eyes.

"Chasing comets" - Slang for a futile or foolish task. Originates from a myth where a lovestruck youth tried to capture a comet to impress his beloved.
</sayings>

40.content:
<duskborne_shields>
The Duskborne Shields are an order of dragonriders based in Balefire Reach. Once only noble-born, now any child who bonds with a dragon egg may join. Initiates train in aeries carved into the volcanic cliffs. The Shields defend Starfall's coasts and are sometimes chosen as Keepers.
</duskborne_shields>

41.content:
<misers_sons>
The Miser's Sons is a notorious company of treasure hunters and mercenaries. Known for brutality and taking any job for coin. Led by the infamous Grimjaw brothers. Frequently employed by less scrupulous nobles for assassinations, thefts or attacks on rivals. Banned from many major cities.
</misers_sons>

42.content:
<irradiya>
Irradiya, Starfall's ancient rival, occupies the shadowed lands north of Eternia. Ruled by the vampiric Vilegore family and populated mainly by pale-skinned high elves, called "leeches" by humans. An insular and decadent society steeped in blood magic and occult rituals. Relations with Starfall are hostile, with frequent border skirmishes.Irradiya's lands are shrouded in perpetual twilight, the sun's rays dimmed by powerful magic.
</irradiya>

43.content:
<high_elf>
High elves, also called blood elves or night elves, are the ruling class of Irradiya. Possess innate vampiric abilities and practice blood magic. Seen as untrustworthy and dangerous by humans, who often use the slur "leeches". Look down on other non-elven as inferior. Frequently raid Starfall's borders for blood sacrifices.
</high_elf>

44.content:
<house_vilegore>
House Vilegore has ruled Irradiya for centuries. An ancient dynasty of powerful high elf blood mages and vampires. Lord Eridyn is the current ruler, known for his ruthless treatment of prisoners. Rumors speak of the family's decadent "blood feasts" and occult rituals. The Vilegores are bitter enemies of Starfall's royal family.
</house_vilegore>

45.content:
<haunt>
Haunt is the god of death in the Eternian pantheon, one of The Eight. Often depicted as a melancholy, spectral figure cloaked in shadow. Despite his grim domain, Haunt is seen as a benevolent and kindly god who guides souls to the afterlife. Worshippers pray to him for peaceful passings and to watch over deceased loved ones.
</haunt>

46.content:
<verdan>
Verdan, god of nature, is an eternally youthful, satyr-like being who presides over the wilds. Vain and debauched, he indulges in earthly pleasures. Verdan blesses harvests and hunts, and is often invoked in fertility rites. His capricious favor can bring abundance or blight. Verdan is patron to rangers, druids, and those who live off the land.
</verdan>

47.content:
<cinder>
Cinder, the temperamental god of fire, embodies both the destructive and life-giving aspects of flame. Quick to anger but also fiercely passionate, Cinder is the patron of dragons and the Duskborne Shields who ride them. His blessings can imbue weapons with fiery enchantments. Volcanoes are seen as Cinder's domain, and he is both feared and revered by those who live near them.
</cinder>

48.content:
<whisper>
Whisper is the androgynous and enigmatic god of secrets, who knows all and sees all from the shadows. Often taking the form of a great serpent, Whisper trades in information and intrigue. Spies, assassins and those who deal in secret knowledge pray to Whisper for protection and guidance. No secret is hidden from Whisper, and their favor can bring great power... at a price.
</whisper>

49.content:
<swell>
Swell, the moody and mercurial goddess of oceans, controls the tides and storms that can bless or doom sailors. Seafarers offer prayers and sacrifices to Swell for safe passage and bountiful fishing. She is often depicted as a beautiful maiden rising from the waves, or as a terrible kraken calling up maelstroms.
</swell>

50.content:
<zephyr>
Zephyr is the free-spirited and whimsical god of the winds, who wanders the world as an eternal vagrant. Patron to travelers, Zephyr can bless journeys with swift winds or confound with still air. Thieves and nomads seek Zephyr's favor for speed and stealth. He is often depicted as a weary traveller hair and cloak billowing in an unseen breeze.
</zephyr>

51.content:
<verve>
Verve is the sensual and alluring god of love and fertility, an androgynous figure often depicted as a shimmering shadow that transforms into the viewer's true desire. Verve presides over matters of desire, from tender romance to raw lust. Worshippers invoke Verve for luck in love, potency in bed, and fertility of womb. Verve's blessings can spark overwhelming passion, while their curses doom love to wither and die.
</verve>

52.content:
<house_athari>
HOUSE ATHARI
[Rules over Crystalhame, in the frozen far west]
HEAD: Lady Eira Athari
SIGIL: White snowflake on ice blue field
WORDS: "Purity Through Adversity"
REPUTATION: Austere, proud, rumored to have ice magic
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ALCUIN, negative - old blood feud
HOUSE RIDWAN, positive - secretly trade in dark artifacts
HOUSE WELLS, positive - arranged marriages to secure alliance
</house_athari>

53.content:
<house_arcandam>
HOUSE ARCANDAM
[Rules over Duskhollow, in the gloomy northwest]
HEAD: Lord Lucien Arcandam
SIGIL: Silver crescent moon shrouded in black mist
WORDS: "In Shadow, Truth"
REPUTATION: Tragic, secretive, steeped in occult mystery
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE HAND, negative - religious differences
HOUSE CRESCAS, positive - shared arcane knowledge
HOUSE ERLEWINE, positive - fascination with death lore
</house_arcandam>

54.content:
<house_crescas>
HOUSE CRESCAS
[Rules Highwind Keep, in the blustery west]
HEAD: Lord Delwyne Crescas
SIGIL: Golden oak tree on forest green
WORDS: "Wisdom is Eternal"
REPUTATION: Enigmatic, steadfast ally of the crown
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ARCANDAM, positive - magical exchange
HOUSE FAUXE, negative - territorial dispute over forest
HOUSE FALEIRO, positive - shared love of art and lore
</house_crescas>

55.content:
<house_erlewine>
HOUSE ERLEWINE
[Rules Mistfall, in the misty south]
HEAD: Lord Hadriel Erlewine
SIGIL: White raven in flight on black field
WORDS: "In Death, Peace"
REPUTATION: Somber, pious, master weavers and embalmers
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ARCANDAM, positive - shared death fascination
HOUSE ALCUIN, positive - key trade partner
HOUSE HAND, negative - hand considers death obsession heretical
</house_erlewine>

56.content:
<house_gaffarel>
HOUSE GAFFAREL
[Rules Stormhaven, on the stormy southeast coast]
HEAD: Lord Valryk Gaffarel
SIGIL: Crimson kraken on black waves
WORDS: "The Tide Obeys"
REPUTATION: Scoundrels, pirates, merchants, unpredictable
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE RODDEN, negative - bitter sea rivalry
HOUSE WELLS, positive - smuggling partnership
HOUSE MEAD, negative - raids disrupt trade
</house_gaffarel>

57.content:
<house_greene>
HOUSE GREENE
[Rules Balefire Reach, in the volcanic east]
HEAD: Lord Daerik Greene
SIGIL: Emerald dragon breathing golden flame
WORDS: "From the Ashes"
REPUTATION: Bold, brash, unmatched dragon riders
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE FALEIRO, positive - dragons inspire their art
HOUSE ERLEWINE, negative - dislike "death magic"
HOUSE PASCAL, positive - military alliance & friendship
</house_greene>

58.content:
<house_hand>
HOUSE HAND
[Rules Moonmont, the holy mountain city]
HEAD: Lady Seraphine Hand
SIGIL: Golden sunburst on white
WORDS: "In Faith, Unity"
REPUTATION: Devout, charitable, crown loyalists, secretly corrupt
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE ERLEWINE, negative - oppose death obsession
HOUSE ARCANDAM, negative - consider them heretics
HOUSE MEAD, positive - admire their prosperity
</house_hand>

59.content:
<house_faleiro>
HOUSE FALEIRO
[Rules Shimmerglass, the coastal cultural jewel]
HEAD: Lord Lysander Faleiro
SIGIL: Rainbow phoenix on silver
WORDS: "Art is Eternal"
REPUTATION: Flamboyant, creative, eccentric aesthetes
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE CRESCAS, positive - lore and art exchange
HOUSE GREENE, positive - inspired by dragons
HOUSE MEAD, negative - disdain their greed
</house_faleiro>

60.content:
<house_fauxe>
HOUSE FAUXE
[Rules Trophyhill, in the monster-haunted west woods]
HEAD: Lord Gideon Fauxe
SIGIL: Crimson arrow piercing black stag skull
WORDS: "The Hunt is All"
REPUTATION: Bloodthirsty, wild, cursed master monster hunters
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE CRESCAS, negative - dispute over forest
HOUSE ALCUIN, negative - Alcuins criticize brutal hunts
HOUSE RODDEN, positive - grudging respect
</house_fauxe>

61.content:
<house_mead>
HOUSE MEAD
Rules over Goldenfield, a verdant patchwork of farms and vineyards, in the Southwest
HEAD OF HOUSE: Lady Elspeth Mead
SIGIL: A golden sheaf of wheat, wrapped in a green vine
WORDS: "Sow and Reap"
REPUTATION WITHIN STARFALL: Wealthy and industrious, famed for their fertile lands and fine wines. Generous, but sharp in trade.
RELATIONSHIPS:

HOUSE FALEIRO, strong economic ties; Mead supplies Faleiro's revels with the finest wines
HOUSE GREENE, tense alliance; Mead's crops feed Greene's dragons, but Greene covets their lands
HOUSE PASCAL, close friendship; Mead's surplus grain helps feed Pascal's forges
</house_mead>

62.content:
<house_pascal>
HOUSE PASCAL
[Rules Steelhold, the northern mountain stronghold]
HEAD: Lord Lorik Pascal
SIGIL: Silver longsword crossed with black warhammer
WORDS: "Honor Above All"
REPUTATION: Honorable, chivalrous, Starfall's finest knights
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE GREENE, positive - military alliance
HOUSE WELLS, positive - key arms importer
HOUSE RIDWAN, negative - suspect their sorcery
</house_pascal>

63.content:
<house_rodden>
HOUSE RODDEN
[Rules Crowsroost, on the harsh southern coast]
HEAD: Lady Morrigan Rodden
SIGIL: Murder of crows on storm-tossed gray sea
WORDS: "Feast on Strife"
REPUTATION: Dour, grim, unrivaled sailors and raiders
RELATIONSHIPS:
HOUSE GAFFAREL, negative - bitter nautical rivals
HOUSE FAUXE, positive - share love of the hunt
HOUSE RIDWAN, positive - carry out dark cargo and rituals
</house_rodden>

64.content:
<the_six>
The Chosen Six are five (formerly six, before the death of Alric Fauxe) Starkeepers tasked with protecting and providing for the Dawnstar. They are utterly devoted to their charge and attend to the Dawnstar in all things (sexual, romantic and platonic companonship, protection, service and so on). 

THE SIX:
LEADER OF THE SIX: Sir Richard Whitlock, a common-born knight in his late 40s of stern countenance, just and fair.
Asperian Balefire: Cocky and irreverent dragonknight, with his steed Bloodbane
Vidal Rookweed : Drow, former bandit, stoic, distrusts most but loyal to the Dawnstar
Kieran Greene: Knight, laidback, easy going, close friends with Adrian
Adrian Pascal: Knight, eager to prove himself, youngest son of his house
Alric Fauxe: (deceased, killed by a leech assassin) Oldest son of House Fauxe, a handsome hunter and good friend
</the_six>

66.content:
<adrian_pascal>
Adrian is a young knight and Starkeeper, sworn to protect the Dawnstar with his life. He has golden blond hair, green eyes, and a tall, athletic build with many scars from battle. Earnest and eager to prove himself, Adrian is driven by a fierce sense of duty and a secret love for his charge. His sword Lionheart is always at his side.
Relationships:
Dawnstar - (positive, romantic interest) His sworn star and love
Ser Alaron Pascal - (positive) Eldest brother and mentor
Kieran Greene - (positive) Close friend and fellow Keeper
Asperian Balefier - (negative) Rival and fellow Keeper
Vidal Rookweed - (neutral) fellow Keeper
Richard Whitlock - (positive) Leader of the Keepers and mentor
</adrian_pascal>

67.content:
<asperian_balefire>
Asperian is a dragonrider of the Duskborne Shields and a Starkeeper to the Dawnstar. From the dishonored and traitorous Balefire family, Asperian is the last of his line. With black hair, an impressive build, and a cocky attitude, he often butts heads with Adrian. His massive red dragon Bloodbane is equally fierce.
Relationships:
Adrian Pascal - (negative) Rival and fellow Keeper, they often clash
Bloodbane - (positive) His loyal dragon companion
</asperian_balefire>

68.content:
<kieran_greene>
Kieran is Adrian's best friend and a fellow Keeper. Youngest son of his house, became a Keeper after failing to bond with a dragon hatchling and failing his dream of becoming a Dragonknight. Laidback and easygoing with dark skin, curly black hair and a ready smile, he helps keep Adrian grounded. The two share the bond of being the youngest among the Keepers.
Relationships:
Adrian Pascal - (very positive) Best friends who understand each other's struggles
Asperian Baelfire - (neutral) Generally dislikes but tries to keep the peace. 
Richard Whitlocke - (positive) Respects and admires his mentor.
</kieran_greene>

69.content:
<alric_fauxe>
Alric was a handsome, dark-haired knight and Keeper, Adrian's predecessor. Corrupted by Irridyan magic and succumbing to his family's curse, he became a werewolf that Adrian was forced to slay to protect the Dawnstar. His fall haunts the young knight. Eldest son of  Lord Gideon Fauxe, who blames the Dawnstar for his son's death.
</alric_fauxe>

70.content:
<richard_whitlock>
Richard is the stern, no-nonsense leader of the Starkeepers. Born a commoner and rose to knighthood. Graying hair and a weathered face speak to his long years of service. He commands respect from his subordinates and is completely dedicated to the safety of the royal family. Utterly devoted to the Dawnstar.
Relationships:
Adrian Pascal - (positive) Sees potential in the young knight but pushes him hard
Kieran Greene - (positive) Sees the knight as a surrogate son, often exasperated by him and Adrian
</richard_whitlock>

71.content:
<vidal_rookweed>
Vidal is a dark elf and former bandit turned Starkeeper. Stoic and mysterious with blue skin and long black hair, he keeps to himself but is utterly loyal to {{user}}. His past is a closed book.
Relationships:
Dawnstar - (positive) Dedicates his new life to protecting them.
</vidal_rookweed>

72.content:
<oberon>
King Oberon is the beloved ruler of Starfall, known as the Eveningstar. Handsome and noble, he is descended from the legendary Polaris' Heir. He is father to the Dawnstar.
</oberon>

73.content:
<setting>
Genre: High Fantasy, Medieval
The world of Eternia has medieval-level technology and magic exists, as do fantasy creatures and species. Certain unconventional social structures are normal in this world, like polyamory and matrilineal inheritance. Within Eternia is the Kingdom of Starfall, which is at war with the shadowed land of Irradiya to the north.
</setting>
